intro: Sageretia kishtwarensis, commonly known as the Kishtware sageretia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of northern China. It belongs to the Rosaceae family, which includes roses and other shrubs, and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a slightly serrated edge, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Sageretia kishtwarensis is adapted to cool, temperate climates and is often found in rocky or forested habitats.
